properties.Name: Pattison State Park Nature Center
properties.description:
Pattison State Park Nature Center

The 1,436-acre Pattison State Park offers the highest waterfalls in Wisconsin and the fourth highest waterfall east of the Rocky Mountains. It also features a lake with a beach, nature programs and guided hikes, camping, and 9 miles of hiking trails.

More information about Pattison State Park Nature Center.

www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Pattison State Park Nature Center
properties.Paragraph1_Text: The 1,436-acre Pattison State Park offers the highest waterfalls in Wisconsin and the fourth highest waterfall east of the Rocky Mountains. It also features a lake with a beach, nature programs and guided hikes, camping, and 9 miles of hiking trails.

properties.Name: Northern Great Lakes Visitors Center
properties.description:
Northern Great Lakes Visitors Center

The Center features a regional History Center and Archives, gift shop, art gallery, theater, and a five-story observation tower offering a panoramic view of Lake Superior and the Apostle Islands Region.

More information about Northern Great Lakes Visitors Center.

www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Northern Great Lakes Visitors Center
properties.Paragraph1_Text: The Center features a regional History Center and Archives, gift shop, art gallery, theater, and a five-story observation tower offering a panoramic view of Lake Superior and the Apostle Islands Region.

properties.Name: Art and Nature Center
properties.description:
Art and Nature Center

Located in an old schoolhouse, the Art and Nature Center, has an art gallery which features the work of local artists. The nature room holds an observation beehive, geologic history of the island and weather phenomena displays, and information about fish, birds and wildlife of the area. A naturalist leads hikes.

More information about Art and Nature Center.

www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Art and Nature Center
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Located in an old schoolhouse, the Art and Nature Center, has an art gallery which features the work of local artists. The nature room holds an observation beehive, geologic history of the island and weather phenomena displays, and information about fish, birds and wildlife of the area. A naturalist leads hikes.

properties.Name: Bjorklunden Seminars
properties.description:
Bjorklunden Seminars

This 425-acre estate on Lake Michigan includes more than a mile of unspoiled waterfront , woods, and meadows. The lodge holds seminars and retreats as well as musical events, and even small weddings.

More information about Bjorklunden Seminars.

www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Bjorklunden Seminars
properties.Paragraph1_Text: This 425-acre estate on Lake Michigan includes more than a mile of unspoiled waterfront , woods, and meadows.  The lodge holds seminars and retreats as well as musical events, and even small weddings.

properties.Name: The Ridges Sanctuary Nature Center
properties.description:
The Ridges Sanctuary Nature Center

Recognized as the most biologically diverse area in Wisconsin, the 1600-acre Ridges Sanctuary is also a National Natural Landmark. Naturalist-guided hikes depart from the nature center all year round.

More information about The Ridges Sanctuary Nature Center.

www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: The Ridges Sanctuary Nature Center
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Recognized as the most biologically diverse area in Wisconsin, the 1600-acre Ridges Sanctuary is also a National Natural Landmark. Naturalist-guided hikes depart from the nature center all year round.

properties.Name: White Cedar Nature Center
properties.description:
White Cedar Nature Center

Peninsula's White Cedar Nature Center is filled with nostalgic photos, taxidermy birds and mammals, a huge light-up map of the park, and a stuffed black bear. Hikes, nature crafts, outdoor skills workshops and more are scheduled throughout the year.

More information about White Cedar Nature Center.

www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: White Cedar Nature Center
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Peninsula's White Cedar Nature Center is filled with nostalgic photos, taxidermy birds and mammals, a huge light-up map of the park, and a stuffed black bear. Hikes, nature crafts, outdoor skills workshops and more are scheduled throughout the year.

properties.Name: Whitefish Dunes State Park Nature Center
properties.description:
Whitefish Dunes State Park Nature Center

Established in 1967, this day use park, named for the sand dunes it was set aside to protect, has many trails for summer and winter use. The nature center features displays on ecology, geology, and human history of the park.

More information about Whitefish Dunes State Park Nature Center.

www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Whitefish Dunes State Park Nature Center
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Established in 1967, this day use park, named for the sand dunes it was set aside to protect, has many trails for summer and winter use.  The nature center features displays on ecology, geology, and human history of the park.

properties.Name: Bay Beach Wildlife Sanctuary
properties.description:
Bay Beach Wildlife Sanctuary

The Bay Beech Wildlife Sanctuary is a 700-acre urban wildlife refuge which features 6 miles of trails, wildlife exhibits, and a Nature Education Center. Open all year with free admission.

More information about Bay Beach Wildlife Sanctuary.

www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Bay Beach Wildlife Sanctuary
properties.Paragraph1_Text: The Bay Beech Wildlife Sanctuary is a 700-acre urban wildlife refuge which features 6 miles of trails, wildlife exhibits, and a Nature Education Center.  Open all year with free admission.

properties.Name: Green Bay Botanical Garden
properties.description:
Green Bay Botanical Garden

Over 47 acres of gardens and natural areas open to the public year round. Gardening classes and other educational programs are offered.

More information about Green Bay Botanical Garden.

www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Green Bay Botanical Garden
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Over 47 acres of gardens and natural areas open to the public year round.  Gardening classes and other educational programs are offered.

properties.Name: West Shores Interpretive Center
properties.description:
West Shores Interpretive Center

Located within the L.H Barkhousen Waterfowl Preserve, a 920-acre preserve featuring forests, meadows, and wetlands, is the West Shores Interpretive Center. It offers educational programs and hands on exhibits about the natural area.

More information about West Shores Interpretive Center.

www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: West Shores Interpretive Center
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Located within the L.H Barkhousen Waterfowl Preserve, a 920-acre preserve featuring forests, meadows, and wetlands, is the West Shores Interpretive Center.  It offers educational programs and hands on exhibits about the natural area.

properties.Name: Point Beach State Forest Nature Center
properties.description:
Point Beach State Forest Nature Center

Point Beach State Park offers 6 miles of Lake Michigan shoreline, with dunes, a lighthouse, camping, and hiking, biking, skiing, nature, and snowmobile trails.

More information about Point Beach State Forest Nature Center.

www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Point Beach State Forest Nature Center
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Point Beach State Park offers 6 miles of Lake Michigan shoreline, with dunes, a lighthouse, camping, and hiking, biking, skiing, nature, and snowmobile trails.

properties.Name: Woodland Dunes Nature Center
properties.description:
Woodland Dunes Nature Center

Woodland Dunes Nature Center is a 1200 acre nature preserve and bird sanctuary located between Manitowoc and Two Rivers. Woodland dunes was designated a state natural area in 1992.

More information about Woodland Dunes Nature Center.

www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Woodland Dunes Nature Center
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Woodland Dunes Nature Center is a 1200 acre nature preserve and bird sanctuary located between Manitowoc and Two Rivers.  Woodland dunes was designated a state natural area in 1992.

properties.Name: Elwood H May Environmental Park
properties.description:
Elwood H May Environmental Park

Ellwood H. May Environmental Park is a 135-acre site that is part of the City of Sheboygan park system and is open to the public, free of charge, year-round.

More information about Elwood H May Environmental Park.

www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Elwood H May Environmental Park
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Ellwood H. May Environmental Park is a 135-acre site that is part of the City of Sheboygan park system and is open to the public, free of charge, year-round.

properties.Name: Sanderling Nature Center
properties.description:
Sanderling Nature Center

Located in the northern area of Kohler-Andrea State Park, the Sanderling Nature Center offers displays of the park's wildlife, history, wildflowers, and more. Atop the center is an observation deck overlooking Lake Michigan.

More information about Sanderling Nature Center.

www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Sanderling Nature Center
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Located in the northern area of Kohler-Andrea State Park, the Sanderling Nature Center offers displays of the park's wildlife, history, wildflowers, and more.  Atop the center is an observation deck overlooking Lake Michigan.

properties.Name: Riveredge Nature Center
properties.description:
Riveredge Nature Center

370 acres of sanctuary and 10 miles of trails, which travel near ponds, praries, and the Milwaukee River, constitutes Riveredge Park. The nature center provides environmental education to learners of all ages.

More information about Riveredge Nature Center.

www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Riveredge Nature Center
properties.Paragraph1_Text: 370 acres of sanctuary and 10 miles of trails, which travel near ponds, praries, and the Milwaukee River, constitutes Riveredge Park. The nature center provides environmental education to learners of all ages.

properties.Name: Boerner Botanical Gardens
properties.description:
Boerner Botanical Gardens

The Boerner Botanical Garden , located in Whitnall Park, offers 11 specialty gardens, tours, and many educational programs.

More information about Boerner Botanical Gardens.

www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Boerner Botanical Gardens
properties.Paragraph1_Text: The Boerner Botanical Garden , located in Whitnall Park, offers 11 specialty gardens, tours, and many educational programs.

properties.Name: Falk Park
properties.description:
Falk Park

Home to the Falk Pavilion, a venue for weddings and other events, Falk Park is part of the Milwaukee County Park System.

More information about Falk Park.

www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Falk Park
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Home to the Falk Pavilion, a venue for weddings and other events, Falk Park is part of the Milwaukee County Park System.

properties.Name: Havenwoods Environmental Awareness Center
properties.description:
Havenwoods Environmental Awareness Center

Havenwoods State Forest offers 237-acres of grasslands, woods, and wetlands in the City of Milwaukee. There are over 6 miles of trails, four ponds, a 120-foot bridge, an education center, heritage gardens, and rain gardens.

More information about Havenwoods Environmental Awareness Center.

www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Havenwoods Environmental Awareness Center
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Havenwoods State Forest offers 237-acres of grasslands, woods, and wetlands in the City of Milwaukee. There are over 6 miles of trails, four ponds, a 120-foot bridge, an education center, heritage gardens, and rain gardens.

properties.Name: Kneeland-Walker House and Victorian Gardens
properties.description:
Kneeland-Walker House and Victorian Gardens

The Kneeland-Walker House and surrounding Victorian Gardens became the headquarters to the Wawatusa Historical Society in 1987. It is used for various educational programs, preservation work, archival storage, artifact displays, and community events.

More information about Kneeland-Walker House and Victorian Gardens.

www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Kneeland-Walker House and Victorian Gardens
properties.Paragraph1_Text: The Kneeland-Walker House and surrounding Victorian Gardens became the headquarters to the Wawatusa Historical Society in 1987. It is used for various educational programs, preservation work, archival storage, artifact displays, and community events.

properties.Name: Martin Schreiber Nature Center
properties.description:
Martin Schreiber Nature Center

This 23-acre nature center features steep bluffs, flood-plain hardwood forest, spring-fed wetland, and a restored prairie. There are five different habitats interconnected by a trail system.

More information about Martin Schreiber Nature Center.

www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Martin Schreiber Nature Center
properties.Paragraph1_Text: This 23-acre nature center features steep bluffs, flood-plain hardwood forest, spring-fed wetland, and a restored prairie. There are five different habitats interconnected by a trail system.

properties.Name: Schlitz Audubon Nature Center
properties.description:
Schlitz Audubon Nature Center

Along the shore of Lake Michigan, this 185-acre park includes six miles of trails and a 60-foot observation tower.

More information about Schlitz Audubon Nature Center.

www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Schlitz Audubon Nature Center
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Along the shore of Lake Michigan, this 185-acre park includes six miles of trails and a 60-foot observation tower.

properties.Name: Urban Ecology Center
properties.description:
Urban Ecology Center

The Urban Ecology Center is an environmental education and nonprofit community center. It has 15-acres of wooded land on the Milwaukee River and a lagoon.

More information about Urban Ecology Center.

www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Urban Ecology Center
properties.Paragraph1_Text: The Urban Ecology Center is an environmental education and nonprofit community center. It has 15-acres of wooded land on the Milwaukee River and a lagoon.

properties.Name: Wehr Nature Center
properties.description:
Wehr Nature Center

Located within Whitnall Park, the Wehr Nature Center consists of 220 acres and 5 natural communities; the Woodland, Wetland, Prairie, Oak Savanna and Lake. Environmental education programs and exhibits are offered in the Visitor Center as well as the outdoor amphitheater.

More information about Wehr Nature Center.

www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Wehr Nature Center
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Located within Whitnall Park, the Wehr Nature Center consists of 220 acres and 5 natural communities; the Woodland, Wetland, Prairie, Oak Savanna and Lake. Environmental education programs and exhibits are offered in the Visitor Center as well as the outdoor amphitheater.

properties.Name: YWCA River Bend Nature Center
properties.description:
YWCA River Bend Nature Center

River Bend Nature Center is located on 80 acres of natural area along the banks of the Root River in Racine. It offers educational programs and seasonal events, as well as free hiking trails through the forests, fields, and wetlands.

More information about YWCA River Bend Nature Center.

www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: YWCA River Bend Nature Center
properties.Paragraph1_Text: River Bend Nature Center is located on 80 acres of natural area along the banks of the Root River in Racine. It offers educational programs and seasonal events, as well as free hiking trails through the forests, fields, and wetlands.

properties.Name: Bong State Recreational Area
properties.description:
Bong State Recreational Area

Richard Bong State Recreation Area became the state's first recreation area in 1974. The 4,515-acre area offers camping, 41 miles of trails, areas to fly model airplanes, rockets, hot air balloons, and hang gliders, as well as areas for training hunting and sled dogs.

More information about Bong State Recreational Area.

www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Bong State Recreational Area
properties.Paragraph1_Text: Richard Bong State Recreation Area became the state's first recreation area in 1974.  The 4,515-acre area offers camping, 41 miles of trails, areas to fly model airplanes, rockets, hot air balloons, and hang gliders, as well as areas for training hunting and sled dogs.

properties.Name: Hawthore Hollow Nature Sanctuary and Arboretm
properties.description:
Hawthore Hollow Nature Sanctuary and Arboretm

This nonprofit nature sanctuary and arboretum offer 40 acres of terrain including two miles of trails, nature center with a classroom and gift shop, and a small amphitheater.

More information about Hawthore Hollow Nature Sanctuary and Arboretm.

www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Hawthore Hollow Nature Sanctuary and Arboretm
properties.Paragraph1_Text: This nonprofit nature sanctuary and arboretum offer 40 acres of terrain including two miles of trails, nature center with a classroom and gift shop, and a small amphitheater.

properties.Name: Pringle Nature Center
properties.description:
Pringle Nature Center

The Pringle Nature Center is located in Bristol Woods County Park, which contains 197 acres of forest, wetlands, paraires, and four miles of trails.

More information about Pringle Nature Center.

www.wisconsincoastalguide.org
properties.Title: Pringle Nature Center
properties.Paragraph1_Text: The Pringle Nature Center is located in Bristol Woods County Park, which contains 197 acres of forest, wetlands, paraires, and four miles of trails.

properties.Name: Seno Woodland Education Center
properties.description:
Seno Woodland Education Center

The Seno Woodland Education Center is 131 acres of forest, fields, prairie and wetlands located in southeast Wisconsin's rolling kettle morraine country.

More information about Seno Woodland Education Center.

www.wisconsincoastalguide.org

properties.Paragraph1_Text: The Seno Woodland Education Center is 131 acres of forest, fields, prairie and wetlands located in southeast Wisconsin's rolling kettle morraine country.
